options.label: D

title: Why do fingers become pruney? - Mark Changizi

multiple-choice.question: Why do scientists think that humans evolved to have pruney fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the surface area of the skin to improve grip in dry conditions.

options.label: B
options.text: To channel out water when gripping in wet conditions, similar to rain treads on car tires.

options.label: C
options.text: To improve the appearance of the fingers.

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the sensitivity of the fingers.

multiple-choice.question: What did doctors notice in the 1930s that led to the study of pruney fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had more pruney fingertips than usual.

options.label: B
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands did not get pruney fingertips like most people do.

options.label: C
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had smoother fingertips than usual.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had more sensitive fingertips than usual.

multiple-choice.question: What is the predicted shape of the wrinkles on pruney fingers if they function like rain treads?

options.label: A
options.text: A network of channels that connect to each other and converge uphill.

options.label: B
options.text: A tree network of divides, or ridges, with their trunk near the top of the fingertip and with their more leaky parts reaching out downhill.

options.label: C
options.text: A smooth surface with no wrinkles.

options.label: D
options.text: A random pattern of wrinkles with no specific shape.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the behavioral experiment that tested the effect of pruney fingers on grip?

options.label: A
options.text: Those with pruney fingers finished the task significantly slower than those with smooth fingers.

options.label: B
options.text: Those with pruney fingers finished the task at the same speed as those with smooth fingers.

options.label: C
options.text: Those with pruney fingers finished the task significantly faster than those with smooth fingers.

options.label: D
options.text: The experiment did not show any significant difference between pruney and smooth fingers.

multiple-choice.question: Why might primates have evolved to have pruney fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they lived in dry, desert habitats and needed to conserve water.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they lost their claws in favor of fingernails and needed a new way to grip in wet conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they wanted to improve the appearance of their fingers.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they needed to increase the sensitivity of their fingers.

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the "lexicon" that the speaker refers to, and why is it important for teaching surgery?

options.label: B
options.text: A lexicon is a set of technical skills that surgeons need to master, and it is important for teaching surgery because it provides a framework for training

options.label: C
options.text: A lexicon is a type of surgical instrument, and it is important for teaching surgery because it provides a tool for surgeons to practice their skills

options.label: D
options.text: A lexicon is a type of patient care, and it is important for teaching surgery because it provides a model for surgeons to follow

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate goal of the speaker's quest for a universal translator, and how does it relate to the field of surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: The ultimate goal is to create a tool that can translate languages in real-time, and it relates to the field of surgery because it will allow surgeons to communicate more effectively with patients and colleagues

options.label: B
options.text: The ultimate goal is to create a tool that can teach surgery to surgeons in their native language, and it relates to the field of surgery because it will improve patient outcomes

options.label: C
options.text: The ultimate goal is to create a tool that can provide medical care to patients in their native language, and it relates to the field of surgery because it will increase access to healthcare

options.label: D
options.text: The ultimate goal is to create a tool that can translate medical texts into different languages, and it relates to the field of surgery because it will improve medical education
